alert.note: Alert for Delaware (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 12 at 5:01PM EDT until June 12 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern New Castle County in northern Delaware... Southwestern Delaware County in southeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 900 PM EDT. * At 501 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. * Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Wilmington, Chester, Swarthmore, Arden, Chelsea, Chester Township, Lima, Concordville, Elam, Nether Providence Township, Talleyville, and Greenville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 8. Interstate 95 in Delaware between mile markers 16 and 23. Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 6. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
